title: Mexican maize
creator_credit: American Museum of Natural History, Dorothy Cinquemani and Roger Sandall
brief_description: A view of life in the high mountains of Guerrero, showing the dependence of Mexican Indian peasants on maize. Shows the men as they burn over the field, plant, and cultivate maize, the women and children as they work and play at preparing tortillos, and the fiesta at the end of the corn ploughing season.
